skill.name: debug-tauri
skill.description: Automates Tauri WebView debugging using official plugins (tauri-plugin-log + screenshots) with process verification, automated screenshots, console logs, and state analysis. Use when debugging Tauri apps, investigating WebView issues, analyzing runtime errors, or troubleshooting UI problems.
skill.summary: Automates Tauri WebView debugging using official plugins (tauri-plugin-log + screenshots) with proce...
skill.author: 8beeeaaat

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate debugging tool for Tauri applications. All 476 static findings are FALSE_POSITIVES: external_command patterns in documentation markdown files show shell command examples; screen capture flags are intentional debugging features (not uploads); filesystem access targets standard log directories; no network operations or credential exfiltration detected. The skill uses official Tauri plugins and performs local debugging operations only.

content.value_statement: Debugging Tauri applications requires collecting screenshots, console logs, and WebView state manually. This skill automates the debugging workflow with official Tauri plugins for screenshot capture, log analysis, and state inspection across macOS, Windows, and Linux.
actual_capabilities: Verify Tauri app process is running with PID and resource metrics
Capture application screenshots using official tauri-plugin-screenshots API
Collect and analyze console logs with pattern detection for errors and warnings
Capture WebView state including URL, title, user agent, and viewport dimensions
Validate debug setup and permissions across all platforms
Generate structured debug reports with visual analysis and performance metrics
limitations: Requires tauri-plugin-debug-tools and tauri-plugin-log installed in target Tauri app
Legacy macOS screencapture script is deprecated and macOS-only
WebView state capture requires debug permissions configured in capabilities/default.json
Cannot debug apps without proper plugin initialization and frontend logger setup

use_cases.title: Debug runtime errors
use_cases.description: Collect screenshots and logs to diagnose crashes, UI glitches, and console errors in Tauri applications.

use_cases.title: Inspect WebView state
use_cases.description: Capture WebView URL, viewport dimensions, and user agent to troubleshoot rendering and layout issues.

use_cases.title: Validate debug setup
use_cases.description: Run validation scripts to ensure logging plugins and screenshot permissions are properly configured.

prompt_templates.title: Quick debug snapshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug my Tauri app by capturing a screenshot and collecting recent console errors. Set TAURI_APP_NAME to the app binary name and run scripts/capture.sh.

prompt_templates.title: Log pattern analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze Tauri console logs for errors and warnings. Set TAURI_BUNDLE_ID to the bundle identifier and run scripts/analyze_logs.sh to identify issues.

prompt_templates.title: Setup validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate that the Tauri debug tools are properly set up. Run scripts/validate_setup.sh with TAURI_BUNDLE_ID to check permissions and plugin status.

prompt_templates.title: Complete debugging session
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete debug workflow: 1) Validate setup with validate_setup.sh, 2) Capture screenshot with capture.sh, 3) Analyze logs with analyze_logs.sh, 4) Generate a debug report using REPORT_TEMPLATE.md structure.

output_examples.input: Debug my Tauri app 'myapp' and collect console errors
output: Errors: 3 (TypeError: undefined is not an object, NetworkError: Failed to fetch, Warning: Component unmounted)

output_examples.input: Analyze logs for patterns and performance issues
output: Recommendation: Check console for TypeErrors before investigating network layer

best_practices: Initialize tauri-plugin-log at app startup for persistent log storage across sessions
Use official plugin API (captureMainWindow) instead of legacy macOS screencapture script
Set TAURI_BUNDLE_ID environment variable for automatic cross-platform log detection
Grant screen recording permission on macOS before running any screenshot capture operations
anti_patterns: Running debug scripts without verifying the Tauri app is running first
Using legacy macOS screencapture instead of cross-platform tauri-plugin-screenshots API
Skipping log analysis and relying only on visual screenshot inspection
Not configuring debug permissions in capabilities/default.json before attempting debugging

faq.question: What Tauri versions are supported?
faq.answer: Requires Tauri v2.0 or later with tauri-plugin-debug-tools and tauri-plugin-log installed in your project.

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Official plugins support macOS, Windows, and Linux. Legacy screencapture script is macOS-only.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my Tauri app?
faq.answer: Install the plugins, initialize logger at app startup, add required permissions to capabilities/default.json.

faq.question: Is my app data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses log files and screenshots created by your app in standard temporary and user directories.

faq.question: Why are my console logs empty?
faq.answer: Ensure logger.initialize() is called at app startup and attachConsole() forwards console output to the plugin.

faq.question: How does this compare to browser devtools?
faq.answer: This skill captures app-level state and logs that browser devtools cannot access, including Rust backend logs and process metrics.
